notes:
[FaceTanking](item_f8af63d1-1fd4-4758-86ce-96f1ef7ea1ea) might seem counterintuitive, considering Zarya uses beam damage, but you'll be getting [Plot Armor](item_d1427316-79d1-43a7-a608-67beb1595131) by round 2, which means you'll be able to heal some of what she dishes out. 

Alternatively, you could pick [Focused Fusion](item_1123c91f-7348-4e50-aa1c-4a9961650f40) this round - and DEFINITELY should do so if you're fighting a non-AP Rein instead - but remember that you'll want to be shooting from midrange, not close range, due to the smaller spread size. 


[Heartbeat Sensor](item_2a4ffaf4-f14b-47d2-a267-0a0e83e87418) is currently (June 18) glitched from what I've tested in the practice range, and doesn't seem to affect D.Va when she's in her mech for some reason. 
If it did work, then it's pretty good for knowing targets to finish off through wallhacks.

If you can afford both [Plot Armor](item_d1427316-79d1-43a7-a608-67beb1595131) and  [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) then absolutely get both. Former will make you able to mitigate some of her beam damage with your DM, in turn healing you for some of it, and the latter makes it so you'll be able to effectively burst through her bubbles. 
Yes, it gives her charge, but over time she's going to end up with high charge anyways, and if you get rid of both her bubbles quickly then she'll be vulnerable to taking large damage. 

If you don't have enough, or have 4k extra, then [Shieldbuster](item_9ee1f150-537d-40b9-b975-7820fb1c6a66) is also very good against Zarya to rinse through the shields portion of her health bar. 

.

VS REIN:
Replace [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) with [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27), and [Plot Armor](item_d1427316-79d1-43a7-a608-67beb1595131) with [Shieldbuster](item_9ee1f150-537d-40b9-b975-7820fb1c6a66) to shred through rein's armor. 

You'll be keeping [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) throughout every round, and [Shieldbuster](item_9ee1f150-537d-40b9-b975-7820fb1c6a66) for a while.

If you decided to pick [Focused Fusion](item_1123c91f-7348-4e50-aa1c-4a9961650f40) round 1, then go with [FaceTanking](item_f8af63d1-1fd4-4758-86ce-96f1ef7ea1ea) now. If you picked [FaceTanking](item_f8af63d1-1fd4-4758-86ce-96f1ef7ea1ea), then either get [Ultrawide Matrix](item_403fe162-4a59-4a8e-8af9-5f83267228e8) for more DM uptime or get [Focused Fusion](item_1123c91f-7348-4e50-aa1c-4a9961650f40) now instead of round 5. 

Adding in [Shieldbuster](item_9ee1f150-537d-40b9-b975-7820fb1c6a66) and a few extra greens for some dps. You could also add in the optional blues if you have the cash. 

.

VS REIN: 
As for power, it's a little more up in the air. Unless you're facing an AP rein, [FaceTanking](item_f8af63d1-1fd4-4758-86ce-96f1ef7ea1ea) is going to do basically nothing against him, but will likely be effective vs the rest of his team. 
Frankly, I'd probably lean into DM-focused survivability regardless, because with [Focused Fusion](item_1123c91f-7348-4e50-aa1c-4a9961650f40) you can be out of rein's melee range and still do effective damage, unlike how D.Va normally is, and DM other kinds of damage trying to come your way. 

Adding in [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) to your build isn't a bad option, as it rein shield counts as a "barrier", but you could also just pick up one or both of the optional blue items instead - depends on whether you wanna do more general dps or break his shield faster.

[Chip-Damage Diverter](item_d31f1c78-8c46-4411-a1f2-c0416efa9e9a) means you'll heal yourself any time you're doing damage to barriers - even after you've gained the max shield health it lists, if that shield health isn't 100% you will still "heal" by doing dps to barriers. Combined with [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61)'s ability to rip through them, it should provide you decent sustain. 
[Multi-Task Mod](item_40997c0f-a8e3-46ba-b312-34c0790d0e87) is another option, but you lose out on some survivability. 

If you don't have enough, then add on some blues and/or greens instead of [Chip-Damage Diverter](item_d31f1c78-8c46-4411-a1f2-c0416efa9e9a). 

Due to D.Va's large armor pool, if you're struggling against enemies focused around WP/AS, you can take [Crusader Hydraulics](item_b64cee07-ca32-405d-987e-868b415bbc09) for some flat damage resistance. 
[Solo Spec](item_a2c2f7c3-761d-42d2-a11c-28980f027c8f) is another survival item that is pretty good, especially at only 4k, but one I didn't find space for in this build. So, take it if you want. 

.

VS REIN:
[Chip-Damage Diverter](item_d31f1c78-8c46-4411-a1f2-c0416efa9e9a) also affects rein's shield, but would be not as effective without [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) as well. If you have enough for [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27), [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) and [Chip-Damage Diverter](item_d31f1c78-8c46-4411-a1f2-c0416efa9e9a), then go for it, but otherwise just pick whether you want to keep [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) (more dps) or [Chip-Damage Diverter](item_d31f1c78-8c46-4411-a1f2-c0416efa9e9a) (more survivability). 

If you can't afford two purples and [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) then just grab some blues and/or greens. (though not [Solo Spec](item_a2c2f7c3-761d-42d2-a11c-28980f027c8f), as that doesn't really help against rein)

If you're picking the powers in the order suggested, then we finally get [Focused Fusion](item_1123c91f-7348-4e50-aa1c-4a9961650f40)! It's a very weird power, as it makes D.Va's playstyle very counter-intuitive to how she usually plays. Remember you don't want to be in people's faces, you're now a midrange tank. Try to stay at least 10m away from the enemies, to upwards of just over 20m. 
This makes it so you're more able to take better angles to hide behind if you get poked out, as well as being able to save your boosters to get *away* from danger, rather than closing distance in order to do effective damage. 
If you have tried and absolutely *despised* this power, then feel free to take [Stat Boost](item_d3ef725b-3183-417c-bc5a-76bfa21c6cc5) as an alternative. 


[Multi-Task Mod](item_40997c0f-a8e3-46ba-b312-34c0790d0e87) lets you shoot while using DM, something that helps you even against zarya when combined with [Plot Armor](item_d1427316-79d1-43a7-a608-67beb1595131) and [FaceTanking](item_f8af63d1-1fd4-4758-86ce-96f1ef7ea1ea). 

If you think you'll run out of DM too quickly, or that's too many buttons for your brain, (boosters in while shooting, using DM and missiles is definitely a lot at once, haha), then there's a few alternative options: 
- [Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d) is especially effective against beam weapons and if you're struggling taking too much damage from Zarya still, it'd be good to slot that in, even potentially in place of something else more DPS-focused in later rounds. 
- [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) is mostly a good dps-heavy item, but also can give you a bit of a movement speed boost. 
- [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) gives you a boost to WP and AP, but also gives you more opportunity for sustain in the form of its lifesteal. There's also the overhealth, which is nice, but as a tank you're probably not going to see the benefit of all that often.

.

VS REIN: 
Bit of the same for powers from this one, more survivability centred around your DM isn't bad due to adding sustain against the rest of his team, though if you really didn't care for that you could go [Express Detonation](item_8da4cbad-78cb-4ebd-8bc4-8dc150afec95) for the surprise factor or [Overstocked](item_d6b946fd-0fd8-4ba1-85d0-601995136eb6) for a little bit of free damage, especially if you take [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643). 

[Multi-Task Mod](item_40997c0f-a8e3-46ba-b312-34c0790d0e87) doesn't do much for you again rein, but with likely enough cash for three purples, then you should be able to get finally get [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27), [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) and [Chip-Damage Diverter](item_d31f1c78-8c46-4411-a1f2-c0416efa9e9a). 
If you don't want to grab all of those however, [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) or [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) are both good against a rein.

Adding in [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) for the combo of some more damage and survivability, but the other purple items under options that I listed last round also would work. 
[Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d) for more survivability, and [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) for more dps. 

Some blues and greens if you can afford them as well, or can't afford the recommended build, though keep in mind that as the rounds go on and everyone gains more health, [Shieldbuster](item_9ee1f150-537d-40b9-b975-7820fb1c6a66) becomes less effective as the percentage of zarya's healthpool that is shields becomes smaller. 

.

VS REIN: 
Your build is likely to look very similar, just with [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) instead of [Multi-Task Mod](item_40997c0f-a8e3-46ba-b312-34c0790d0e87) and one of the optional blues instead of [Plot Armor](item_d1427316-79d1-43a7-a608-67beb1595131). 

Same reminder though, that as the rounds go on and health bars become larger, [Shieldbuster](item_9ee1f150-537d-40b9-b975-7820fb1c6a66) becomes less effective, as less of rein's health % is armor. 
Don't get rid of [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) because of this though, as the flat 15% WP is worth it, and D.Va's style of gun is less effective against armor so the bonus is still nice to have.

The final power depends on what you feel you'd get more use out of:
[Stat Boost](item_d3ef725b-3183-417c-bc5a-76bfa21c6cc5): more DM uptime
[Party Protector](item_1ef9061d-cfa4-4f4e-a262-ab1012438e69): safer re-mech for you, and overhealth for your teammates
[Express Detonation](item_8da4cbad-78cb-4ebd-8bc4-8dc150afec95): surprise factor, enemies will likely not expect your ult to explode as fast as it does. 

If you wanted to swap in one of the optional items for something, I'd suggest picking between [Multi-Task Mod](item_40997c0f-a8e3-46ba-b312-34c0790d0e87) (more versatility and DPS), [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) (higher DPS and some movement speed) or [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) (mix of DPS and survivability). The items are: 
- [Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d): as said before, this is especially good against beam weapons like zarya, so if you want survivability this is the go-to. 
- [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b): just a very good item, adds a lot of DPS and ability to finish off kills. It is expensive though. 
- [El-sa'ka Supressor](item_b4298dd9-9b93-461f-a2e0-843402667100): it doesn't have as much raw DPS output than any of the other options that aren't focused on survivability, but in turn it gives enemies an anti-heal debuff whenever a single one of the pellets of your guns hits a headshot. This effect can be cleansed by zarya bubbles, but you should be shredding through those, and you're forcing her to use them just to cleanse the effect. 

.

VS REIN: 
For powers, it's pretty much the same thing as listed above for zarya. 

Same as last round, your build will look pretty much the same save for [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) over [Multi-Task Mod](item_40997c0f-a8e3-46ba-b312-34c0790d0e87) and [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) or [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) instead of [Plot Armor](item_d1427316-79d1-43a7-a608-67beb1595131).

Also similarly to the zarya version of the build, it's your choice if you want to replace [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) (mix dps and survivability through sustain) or [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) (dps and small movement speed buff) with:
- [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b): high dps output and ability to finish low-health targets.
- [El-sa'ka Supressor](item_b4298dd9-9b93-461f-a2e0-843402667100): less pure dps than other options, but in exchange applies anti-heal debuff to anyone hit in the head with a pellet from your gun. 

Unlike the zarya version of the build, if you happen to have way more cash, you could also swap out the final blue item for another purple, since you aren't required to keep [Plot Armor](item_d1427316-79d1-43a7-a608-67beb1595131).
